docs.text: Semsql schema A datamodel for RDF, OWL, and OBO Ontologies designed to work harmoniously with SQL databases. See https://github.com/cmungall/semantic-sql for GitHub repo Classes Node BlankNode ClassNode IriNode NamedIndividualNode OntologyNode OwlRestriction OwlSomeValuesFrom Prefix - Maps CURIEs to URIs Problem - Represents an instance of a problem pertaining to conformance to OBO guidelines NodeWithTwoLabelsProblem PropertyNode AnnotationPropertyNode ObjectPropertyNode TransitivePropertyNode Statements - Represents an RDF triple OwlEquivalentClassStatement RdfTypeStatement - A statement that indicates the asserted type of the subject entity RdfsLabelStatement RdfsSubClassOfStatement Mixins Slots base description filler id language object - Note the range of this slot is always a node. If the triple represents a literal, instead value will be populated owl equivalent class statement➞object - One of the two classes that are equivalent. No significance to subject vs object rdf type statement➞object - The entity type rdfs subClassOf statement➞object - The superclass element of the triple on property predicate prefix restriction stanza subject owl equivalent class statement➞subject - One of the two classes that are equivalent. No significance to subject vs object problem➞subject - The thing that is problematic rdfs subClassOf statement➞subject - The subclass element of the triple value - Note the range of this slot is always a string. Only used the triple represents a literal assertion Enums Types Built in Bool Decimal ElementIdentifier NCName NodeIdentifier URI URIorCURIE XSDDate XSDDateTime XSDTime float int str Defined Boolean ( Bool ) - A binary (true or false) value Date ( XSDDate ) - a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar Datetime ( XSDDateTime ) - The combination of a date and time Decimal ( Decimal ) - A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal specification Double ( float ) - A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification Float ( float ) - A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification Integer ( int ) - An integer LiteralAsStringType ( String ) Ncname ( NCName ) - Prefix part of CURIE NodeIdType ( Uriorcurie ) Nodeidentifier ( NodeIdentifier ) - A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model. Objectidentifier ( ElementIdentifier ) - A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model. String ( str ) - A character string Time ( XSDTime ) - A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day Uri ( URI ) - a complete URI Uriorcurie ( URIorCURIE ) - a URI or a CURIE
docs.title: Home

docs.text: A datamodel for RDF, OWL, and OBO Ontologies designed to work harmoniously with SQL databases. See https://github.com/cmungall/semantic-sql for GitHub repo
docs.title: Semsql schema

docs.text: Node BlankNode ClassNode IriNode NamedIndividualNode OntologyNode OwlRestriction OwlSomeValuesFrom Prefix - Maps CURIEs to URIs Problem - Represents an instance of a problem pertaining to conformance to OBO guidelines NodeWithTwoLabelsProblem PropertyNode AnnotationPropertyNode ObjectPropertyNode TransitivePropertyNode Statements - Represents an RDF triple OwlEquivalentClassStatement RdfTypeStatement - A statement that indicates the asserted type of the subject entity RdfsLabelStatement RdfsSubClassOfStatement
docs.title: Classes

docs.text: base description filler id language object - Note the range of this slot is always a node. If the triple represents a literal, instead value will be populated owl equivalent class statement➞object - One of the two classes that are equivalent. No significance to subject vs object rdf type statement➞object - The entity type rdfs subClassOf statement➞object - The superclass element of the triple on property predicate prefix restriction stanza subject owl equivalent class statement➞subject - One of the two classes that are equivalent. No significance to subject vs object problem➞subject - The thing that is problematic rdfs subClassOf statement➞subject - The subclass element of the triple value - Note the range of this slot is always a string. Only used the triple represents a literal assertion
docs.title: Slots

docs.text: Bool Decimal ElementIdentifier NCName NodeIdentifier URI URIorCURIE XSDDate XSDDateTime XSDTime float int str
docs.title: Built in

docs.text: Boolean ( Bool ) - A binary (true or false) value Date ( XSDDate ) - a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar Datetime ( XSDDateTime ) - The combination of a date and time Decimal ( Decimal ) - A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal specification Double ( float ) - A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification Float ( float ) - A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification Integer ( int ) - An integer LiteralAsStringType ( String ) Ncname ( NCName ) - Prefix part of CURIE NodeIdType ( Uriorcurie ) Nodeidentifier ( NodeIdentifier ) - A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model. Objectidentifier ( ElementIdentifier ) - A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model. String ( str ) - A character string Time ( XSDTime ) - A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day Uri ( URI ) - a complete URI Uriorcurie ( URIorCURIE ) - a URI or a CURIE

String ( str ) - A character string Time ( XSDTime ) - A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day Uri ( URI ) - a complete URI Uriorcurie ( URIorCURIE ) - a URI or a CURIE
